paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for KCNH2, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: Various ages and sexes, specific details not provided
patients.phenotype: Congenital short QT syndrome (SQTS) with abbreviated QT intervals and arrhythmias

individual_records.phenotype_details: Asymptomatic until later episode of syncope
individual_records.evidence_sentence: She was found to have the S631A mutation and a QTc interval of less than 320 ms.
The E50D mutation has been suggested to increase hERG ‘tail' current magnitude, slow deactivation time-course and produce a modest (approx. 11–12 mV) positive shift in voltage-dependent inactivation.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Mixed BrS/SQTS phenotype with QTc interval of 329 ms
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The C terminal R1135H mutation was found in a 34-year-old man with a mixed BrS/SQTS phenotype (QTc interval of 329 ms).

individual_records.phenotype_details: Presented with palpitations and near syncope due to AF and atrial flutter
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The I560T hERG mutation was reported in a 64-year-old man who presented with palpitations and near syncope owing to AF and atrial flutter.

functional_data.summary: Mutations in KCNH2 lead to gain-of-function effects, resulting in abbreviated QT intervals and increased susceptibility to arrhythmias.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, mutations segregate with disease in families.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence for pathogenicity based on multiple studies.
variants.additional_notes: The paper discusses multiple mutations in KCNH2 associated with SQTS.
key_quotes: KCNH2 (also known as hERG; human Ether-à-go-go Related Gene) was definitively linked to SQTS.
The most commonly identified SQTS (and SQT1) mutation to date is the T618I hERG mutation, which has been found in multiple SQTS families.

tables_processed.table_caption: A list of genes and associated mutations that have been linked to congenital SQTS.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for KCNH2 variants were extracted successfully.
